data.title: Annette Bening Bio, Children, Husband – Warren Beatty and Net Worth
data.meta_description: Annette Bening is one of those veteran actresses who starred in movies that have remained a favorite in the hearts of many. Some of her credits
data.text:
Annette Bening is one of those veteran actresses who starred in movies that have remained a favorite in the hearts of many. Some of her credits include The Grifters (1990), American Beauty (1999), Being Julia (2004), and The Kids Are Alright (2010); all for which she received an Oscarnomination. Although she missed the Oscar for American Beauty, Bening’s believable portrayal of her role as Carolyn Burnham won her a BAFTA as well as a SAG Award. The American actress shows no signs of slowing down as she continues to maintain a commendable level of activity in the entertainment world.

Annette Bening Biography,

Annette Carol Bening was born on May 29, 1958 in Topeka, Kansas to Shirley Katherine (née Ashley) and Arnett Grant Bening, both originally from Iowa. Annette is the youngest of her parents’ children. she has three older siblings. Although born in Topeka, Bening grew up for most of her childhood in Wichita, Kansas, where her family had moved in 1959. The family would later move to San Diego, California in 1965, after her father, insurance representative and sales training. consultant got a job there.

Born to conservative Republicans, Bening as raised as an Episcopal, she would become a Democrat. She got her artistic side from her mother who was the soloist at the church they attended.

Annette Bening attended Patrick Henry High School where she participated in numerous plays, including a production of Sound of Music in her freshman year. Fresh out of high school, Annette Bening started making a living working on a charter boat as a cook.

She then attended San Francisco State University where she earned a degree in performing arts. The year 1980 was when Annette Bening officially started acting professionally. She started in the stage and quickly advanced seven years later (in 1987). She made her Broadway debut in Coastal Disturbance which earned her a Tony Award nomination.

The following year (1988), Annette Bening decided to go into screen work. His first film was The Great Outdoors (1988). Two years later, Bening had his big break with a role in The Grifters (1990) which earned him his first Oscar.

Annette had a few flops in the 90s but remained relentless. Her most notable performance during this period came in American Beauty, Sam Mendes’ directorial debut, which won 5 Oscars.

The new millennium arrived and Annette Bening continued to prove what an actress she was with roles in Open Range (2003), Being Julia (2004) and more.

Bening has arguably been more dominant on the big screen, however, she’s had a couple of notable gigs on the small screen. The actress received an Emmy for her role in the TV movie, Mrs. Harris

His net worth

Annette achieved resounding success in a career that many have come to admire. Annette Bening, who acts as the main source of wealth, has a net worth of $50 million.

Children, Husband – Warren Beatty

Annette Bening has been married twice in her lifetime. Her current husband is Warren Beatty – an actor and filmmaker. The duo married on March 3, 1992, a year after filming the 1991 film, Bugsy. Annette is 21 years younger than her husband, but regardless of their age difference, the duo have managed to remain a couple for decades.

The long life of their union comes as a surprise to many people due to the fact that Warren Beatty was once famous for being a Hollywood Playboy. Back in his prime, the actor and filmmaker was a real tabloid, thanks to his romantic relationships with other high-profile stars. His lovers include actress Joan Collins, to whom he was briefly engaged before infidelity tore them apart, and singer-songwriter Carly Simon. It is said that his song, You Are So Vain was about him.

Warren Beatty is as successful in acting as he is in film. His heyday spanned the 1960s through the late 1990s. Beatty is the only one ever to be nominated for the same film as an actor, director, screenwriter and producer, a feat he has already accomplished twice – once. premiered in 1978 Heaven Can Wait and later in The Reds. Eight of Beatty’s films have received 53 Oscar nominations. In 1999, the Oscars rewarded their efforts with their highest honor, the Irving G. Thalberg Award. Since the new millennium, Beatty has slowed down his activity in Hollywood.

Annette Bening and her husband Beatty have been blessed with four children – two sons and two daughters. Before Beatty, Annette was married to a choreographer, J. Steven White. The union lasted from May 26, 1984 to 1991.
